titles.title: Shin Mazinger Shougeki! Z Hen on Television
True Mazinger Impact! Z Chapter
True Mazinger
True Mazinger Impact! Z Chapter on television
Mazinger Edition Z - The Impact
مازنجر الحقيقي
Shin Mazinger
真魔神Z
真マジンガー 衝撃! Z編 on television
Mazinger Edition Z: The Impact!
Mazinger Z: Edición Impacto!

similaranime.anime: Giant Robo The Animation: Chikyuu ga Seishi Suru Hi

recommendations.recommendation:
Basically this is a great remake and IMO the perfect example on how to transfer the 40 year old Super Robot show formular into modern times. Compress 92 episodes into 26, while at the same time doubling the amount of characters and story elements and you make an unbearable monster-of-the-week drag into a rollercoaster ride of fun.
A must-see for Super Robot fans, but it won`t convert anyone who never liked the kind to being with - so recommended for fans.

anime.description: In the near future, a mineral known as "Japanium" is discovered under Mt. Fuji. This ore is discovered to produce a powerful energy source known as "Photon Energy". http://anidb.net/ch5584 [Dr. Kabuto Juuzou] and his associates have begun researching Photon Energy, planning to use it as a solution to the energy crisis plaguing the earth, when the nefarious http://anidb.net/ch5563 [Dr. Hell] and his associate, http://anidb.net/ch5567 [Baron Ashura] attack his lab. Along with this, the mysterious "Kurogane House" also has begun to become entwined with the affairs of these two parties. During all of this, Juuzou`s grandchildren, http://anidb.net/ch5577 [Kouji] and http://anidb.net/ch5562 [Shirou], encounter one of Baron Ashura`s robots on its way to attack Dr. Kabuto`s mansion, where he has begun work on his greatest invention. Dr. Kabuto, seeing the danger at hand, sends out the Pilder to Kouji, allowing him to combine with the giant robot, Mazinger Z, to fight against Dr. Hell`s forces. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: maintenance tags
tag.description: These tags are used for maintenance.

tag.name: shounen
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shounen, literally meaning "youth" and often also specifically "boy", refers to a male audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: android
tag.description: An android is a robot or synthetic organism designed to look and act like a human.

tag.name: alien
tag.description: This entity or creature was born on another world than the main characters.

tag.name: robot
tag.description: A robot is an automatically guided machine, able to do tasks on its own. Another common characteristic is that by its appearance or movements, a robot often conveys a sense that it has intent or agency of its own. Not to be confused with android (human-like robot).

tag.name: content indicators
tag.description: The content indicators branch is intended to be a less geographically specific tool than the `age rating` used by convention, for warning about things that might cause offence. Obviously there is still a degree of subjectivity involved, but hopefully it will prove useful for parents with delicate children, or children with delicate parents. Note: Refer to further guidance on http://wiki.anidb.net/w/Categories:Content_Indicators [the Wiki page] for how to apply tag weights for content indicators.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: calling your attacks
tag.description: "GIGAAAAAA DRIIIIIILLL BREAKEEEEEERRR" If you can do something more impressive than just throw a punch, your attack(s) must have an equally impressive name. More than that, you have to call it out as you launch the attack. It doesn`t matter if it`s a martial arts move, a magical spell or your secret superweapon, if you can`t say its name, it just isn`t nearly as cool or effective. Having a special attack is always a must, but not impressive enough. Every special attack needs a name. A really awesome and outstanding name which is easy to remember and even easier and impressive to yell. Because it just is not enough to name your attack. No, to unleash the full power of your attack, you have to call its name in your most MANLY and LOUDEST voice. It does not matter whether it is a martial arts move, a magical spell or flying drills from your mecha, if you can`t call its name, it just isn`t nearly as cool or effective. Not a requirement but wearing shades while calling your attack makes it at least twice as cool, moreover giving your mecha or magical companion shades too results in an immeasurable level of awesomeness, bringing down every enemy just through the POWER OF YOUR VOICE. A standard feature of practically every mecha, mahou shoujo, high fantasy, or martial arts anime. [Source: TV Tropes]

tag.name: battle royale
tag.description: Many characters are removed from their normal lives or lifestyles and thrown into a game where they are forced to battle each other until one survivor remains. Much like the famous film `Battle Royale`.

tag.name: swordplay
tag.description: The act or art of using a sword or similar weapon skillfully.

tag.name: time travel
tag.description: In time travel anime characters are transported through time either figuratively or literally to find themselves either in the past or the future

tag.name: mecha
tag.description: Mecha in Japanese basically means mechanical things; everything from an electric whisk or a car to a spaceship or a robot. Here however we limit it to the more exotic things usually referred to as mecha anime: robots, whether controlled by a human or not, and their ilk. See Androids, Piloted Robots, Power Suits, Robot Helpers, Transforming Robots for a more specific classification.

tag.name: piloted robot
tag.description: Piloted Robots are, as the name suggests, robots that cannot control themselves; they need to be steered from somewhere, this can be from a human sitting inside or a remote controlled option.

tag.name: demon
tag.description: In Western lore, demons are often described as minions from Hell, generally known to attack humans and feast on their flesh or possess the bodies of those with weak souls. In Eastern lore, on the other hand, they are generally supernatural, often but not always malevolent beings who can be more mischievous than actually evil, or simply supernatural spirits of no specific alignment.

tag.name: dark fantasy
tag.description: Focus set on darker themes in a fantasy setting, sometimes leaning towards horror elements. Bleak and pessimistic tones often dominate. Dark supernatural beings like vampires may play a significant role.

tag.name: parody
tag.description: Anime that imitate other stories (can be from TV, film, books, historical events, ...) for comic effect by exaggerating the style and changing the content of the original. Also known as spoofs. It can also refer to when whole elements of one work are lifted out of their context and reused.

tag.name: nudity
tag.description: Nudity is the state of wearing no clothing. The wearing of clothing is exclusively a human characteristic. The amount of clothing worn depends on functional considerations (such as a need for warmth or protection from the elements) and social considerations. In some situations the minimum amount of clothing (i.e. covering of a person`s genitals) may be socially acceptable, while in others much more clothing is expected. Note: Refer to further guidance on http://wiki.anidb.net/w/Categories:Content_Indicators [the Wiki page] for how to apply tag weights for content indicators. People, as individuals and in groups, have varying attitudes towards their own nudity. Some people are relaxed about appearing less than fully clothed in front of others, while others are uncomfortable or inhibited in that regard. People are nude in a variety of situations, and whether they are prepared to disrobe in front of others depends on the social context in which the issue arises. For example, people need to bathe without clothing, some people also sleep in the nude, some prefer to sunbathe in the nude or at least topless, while others are nude in other situations. Some people adopt naturism as a lifestyle. Though the wearing of clothes is the social norm in most cultures, some cultures, groups and individuals are more relaxed about nudity, though attitudes often depend on context. On the other hand, some people feel uncomfortable in the presence of any nudity, and the presence of a nude person in a public place can give rise to controversy, irrespective of the attitude of the person who is nude. Besides meeting social disapproval, in some places public nudity may constitute a crime of indecent exposure. Many people have strong views on nudity, which to them can involve issues and standards of modesty, decency and morality. Some people have an psychological aversion to nudity, called gymnophobia. Many people regard nudity to be inherently sexual and erotic. Nudity is to be found in a multitude of media, including art, photography, film and on the Internet. It is a factor in adult entertainment of various types. Especially gratuitous fanservice anime shows tend to show their (usually female) characters frequently without any clothes, though often hiding genitals through the means of additions like steam. Source: wiki

tag.name: parasite
tag.description: Parasites are life forms that feed off other beings in some way. In anime, they are often aliens and usually intelligent. For shock value, and to avoid having to draw aliens all the time, their prey is preferably human; they may see humans as food, as puppets for mind control, or simply as temporary body hosts. In every case, the human is the victim of a "merging", which is not to be confused with the more "amicable" symbiosis.

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: science fiction
tag.description: Science fiction stories usually focus on how situations could be different in the future when we are more technologically advanced; due to either our own achievements or having met with other civilizations whom we have learned from.

tag.name: fantasy
tag.description: Fantasy is a genre of fiction that uses magic and other supernatural phenomena as a primary element of plot, theme, or setting. Many works within the genre take place in fictional worlds where magic is common. Fantasy is generally distinguished from science fiction and horror by the expectation that it steers clear of (pseudo-)scientific and macabre themes, respectively, though there is a great deal of overlap between the three (which are subgenres of speculative fiction). In popular culture, the genre of fantasy is dominated by its medievalist form, especially since the worldwide success of The Lord of the Rings books by J. R. R. Tolkien. In its broadest sense however, fantasy comprises works by many writers, artists, filmmakers, and musicians, from ancient myths and legends to many recent works embraced by a wide audience today. Fantasy is a vibrant area of academic study in a number of disciplines (English, cultural studies, comparative literature, history, medieval studies). Work in this area ranges widely, from the structuralist theory of Tzvetan Todorov, which emphasizes the fantastic as a liminal space, to work on the connections (political, historical, literary) between medievalism and popular culture Source: Wiki

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: tragedy
tag.description: Tragedy is a form of drama characterized by seriousness and dignity, usually involving a conflict between a character and some higher power, such as the law, the gods, fate, or society.

tag.name: super robot
tag.description: These robots tend to have almost semi-magical attacks, which seem impossible or non-realistic, and/or perform non-realistic transformation sequences where they seem to gain/lose mass and utterly change their form, even if it means making their super-hard armour bend like plastic sheets.

tag.name: boob cannon
tag.description: A female character that utilizes their healthy pair in the form of a weapon relative to a cannon, machine gun, missile launcher, or other similar device. Examples may differ from comical to primary weaponry in humanoid-robotics, such as in the OVA "Lingerie Senshi Papillon Rose" or some villains in "Cutey Honey Flash" (where breasts become rocket launchers or machine guns). Other instances are serious forms of attack, which the demonic character Melona (Merona) of the Queen`s Blade franchise is well known for - her hair extends downward from her head cupping under her breasts in appearance of hands, which then squeeze... http://anidb.net/t4594 [an extremely acidic lactation of sorts] as the disturbing result.

tag.name: world domination
tag.description: "Gee, Brain, what do you want to do tonight?" "The same thing we do every night, Pinky: try to take over the world!" A main objective for one of the characters is absolute control of not just one country, but a whole planet!

tag.name: remake
tag.description: This anime is a remake of a previously released story, anime, or movie.

tag.name: mythology
tag.description: The anime gets inspirations from many forms of mythologies (either Greek, Egyptian, Nord, etc.) to form its story and setting.

tag.name: symbiotic aliens
tag.description: Aliens form symbiotic relationships with humans or some other creatures in this anime.

tag.name: daikaijuu
tag.description: Literally translating to giant monster, daikaiju is an element found often in Japanese entertainment. Although usually for the science fiction genre it is also often used in horror, fantasy, mecha, and to a lesser extent comedy. Any monster that towers over a house technically qualifies as a daikaiju. Some anime, usually mecha, will go as far as calling their daikaiju with a specific title.

tag.name: dysfunctional family
tag.description: When the nuclear family (Mother, Father and child(ren)) goes boom due to conflicts between family members, sometimes resulting in the breakup of the family or even violence.

tag.name: Greek mythology
tag.description: The anime is derived or draws elements from the Greek mythology, and as such features some mythological characteristics of Ancient Greece. Those may be creatures, such as the Centaur or Hydra, tales, such as that of the Trojan War, or even the Gods themselves, like Zeus or Poseidon. More subtle references also count, such as the careful usage of names of places or people that hold significance in the myths.

tag.name: call my name
tag.description: "TETSUOOOOOO!!" "KANEDAAAAAA!!" "TAMAHOMEEEE!!" "MIAKAAAA!!" Feelings of any kind towards other characters are best shown by calling each other`s name, loud, REALLY LOUD. For better effect at least twice or thrice. For lover`s couples and mortal enemies it is a requirement to run towards each other while calling each other`s name, unaware of the surroundings.

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO CHARACTER
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to character tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what characters they should be assigned to.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: multi-anime projects
tag.description: Many anime are created as part of larger projects encompassing many shows without direct relation to one another. Normally, there is a specific idea in mind: for example, the http://anidb.net/t4859 [Young Animator Training Project] aims to stimulate the on-the-job training of next-generation professionals of the anime industry, whereas the http://anidb.net/t3763 [World Masterpiece Theatre] aims to animate classical stories from all over the world.

tag.name: tropes
tag.description: A trope is a commonly recurring literary and rhetorical devices, motifs or clichés in creative works. This use is a broader redefining of a literary trope, the use of figurative language, via word, phrase, or even an image, for artistic effect, such as using a figure of speech. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: ancient aliens
tag.description: Ancient aliens, hundreds, thousands, or millions of years in the past; aliens from another world or dimension played a significant role in human history. Pictured: http://anidb.net/a40 [Nadia: The Secret of The Blue Water / Fushigi no Umi no Nadia]

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: Super Robot Wars
tag.description: Super Robot Wars is a series of tactical role-playing video games produced by Banpresto. The main feature of the franchise is having a story that crosses over several popular mecha anime, manga and video games, allowing characters and mecha from different titles to team up or battle one another. Due to the nature of crossover games and licensing involved, only a few games have been released outside Japan, and in English; early English-language games only feature Banpresto`s original characters and mecha, and a flagship installment were to never be released until 2016, with the English release of Super Robot Wars V in Southeast Asian countries. The franchise celebrated its 25th anniversary in 2016. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Kabuto Shirou
character.description: Kabuto Shirou is Kabuto Kouji`s younger brother. Most of the time, Shirou`s role is to add some comic relief to the plot. His character acquires a bit more depth in Great Mazinger, as he becomes acquainted with his father Kenzou, who was previously thought to be dead. He pilots his own robot in Great Mazinger, the Robot Junior.

character.name: Ashura Danshaku
character.description: Baron Ashura is the main henchman of Dr. Hell, the antagonist of Kabuto Kouji. He/she is notable for being voiced by two simultaneous seiyuu as well as being a half-man, half-woman combination. Mazinger`s most persistent enemy, it makes regular appearances in the Super Robot Wars series as Dr. Hell`s loyal underling. In Shin Mazinger Shougeki! Z Hen, Baron Ashura`s appearance is faithful to its role although its origin was given more depth as it is revealed in the series Ashura was a pair of Mikene servants name Tristian and Isolde.

character.name: Kabuto Juuzou
character.description: Dr. Kabuto Juuzou is Kenzou`s father and grandfather to both Kouji and Shirou. He was a previous colleague of Dr. Hell`s and created Mazinger Z in order to oppose Hell`s plans for world domination. Hell sent Baron Ashura to kill Juuzou before he could present a threat, and he was fatally injured in the attack, but survived long enough to tell Kouji about Mazinger Z and how it must be used to defeat Dr. Hell. In the Mazinkaiser OVA, Kabuto Juuzou was retconned into surviving without Kouji or anyone`s knowledge, and worked in another secret underground laboratory where he finished the final and more powerful version of Great Mazinger and then his ultimate creation, Mazinkaiser. He later appeared to Kouji via hologram, telling him about Mazinkaiser. Whether he was still alive, and if so, where he currently was, is unknown. Note that, in the original manga and the Mazinkaiser OVA, Kabuto Juuzou presents several physical scars (more exactly, half his face is burned) and is more hot-tempered and even slightly megalomaniac. His TV series rendition is lots more calmer and stable, and also has a rather normal outlook. His Shin Mazinger incarnation however seems to be every bit as megalomaniacal as the manga version.

character.name: Nishikiori Tsubasa
character.description: The landlady of the onsen ryokan Kurogane-ya (くろがね屋) . Mostly referred to as landlady (女将).

character.name: Rooru
character.description: Lori & Loru are two voluptuous twin sisters who begin working at the institute as lab assistants. They`re sexy and fanservicey, yet in the time of need they`re also smart and brave. The twin sisters pilot the robot Million Alpha in the Mazinkaiser manga and sequel movie. Loru usually dressed in pink and was the older sister. Her hair color was slightly different, in two shades of blonde.

character.name: Roorii
character.description: Lori & Loru are two voluptuous twin sisters who begin working at the institute as lab assistants. They`re sexy and fanservicey, yet in the time of need they`re also smart and brave. The twin sisters pilot the robot Million Alpha in the Mazinkaiser manga and sequel movie. Lori, the younger of the sisters, usually wore light blue clothes and had lighter hair.

character.name: Lorelei Heinrich
character.description: Dr. Heinrich`s daughter and Shiro`s love interest. She is an android who can fuse with Schtroheim`s other creation, the giant robot Donau α1 (Alpha 1), and battles Mazinger Z in order to fulfill her father`s dream of surpassing Juzo`s creation to become the greatest robot engineer of all. Her story and name seem to be inspired in the German poem Die Lorelei by Heinrich Heine.

character.name: Kabuto Kenzou
character.description: Kenzou was the son of Kabuto Juuzou, the inventor of Mazinger Z, but working in secret he improved upon the original designs to create the more formidable Great Mazinger. After a laboratory experiment that went wrong, he and his wife are thought to be dead. However, he was instead turned into a cyborg by his father in order to keep him alive. To shield them from danger and psychological shock, Kenzou`s sons Kouji and Shirou are unaware of this and grow believing both of their parents are dead, and were raised by Juuzou. Kenzou reveals the truth to both of them in the Great Mazinger series, first to Shirou, since Kouji was away for a big part of the series, and their relationship would cause conflict with his adopted son Tsurugi Tetsuya, who was raised by Kenzou together with his best friend Jun and comes to feel intensely jealous of Kenzou`s actual children, especially so of Kouji. Dr. Kabuto would eventually die in battle at the end of the series and Tetsuya and Koji fight together to avenge his death. Source: Wikipedia

episode.title: 大団円
Grand Finale
Desenlace
Daidan`en
episode.summary: It`s the beginning of the end, with the forces of Dr. Hell throwing their might against the Mazinger Army! But how did things come to this? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 始動! マジンガー!
Activation! Mazinger!
¡Adelante, Mazinger!
Shidou! Mazinger!
episode.summary: Once a normal kid, Koji Kabuto`s destiny began on the day Dr. Hell launched his campaign for world conquest. Targeted by gangs, robots, and soldiers, Koji survives only when Grandpa Juzo reveals what he`s been working on these past ten years! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 発射! 光子力ビーム!!
Fire! Photonic Beam!!
Raggi fotonici
¡Fuego! ¡El Rayo Fotónico!
Hassha! Koushiryoku Beam!!
episode.summary: The final, greatest weapon: the Photon Beam. A new day dawns over Atami thanks to Koji and Mazinger Z, but the previous night`s sacrifices leave everyone with questions... and Koji in jail. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 強襲! ブロッケン伯爵
Assault! Count Brocken
¡El asalto del Conde Brocken!
Kyoushuu! Brocken Hakushaku
episode.summary: Rust Hurricane! Breast Fire! Rocket Punch! Grandpa Juzo shows Koji how to control Mazinger Z, but the fight isn`t over yet! As Baron Ashura retreats, Count Brocken arrives, and he wants to start things off with a bang! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 激戦! 機械獣VSマジンガー
Fierce Battle! Mechanical Beasts vs. Mazinger
¡Duelo!¡Las bestias mecánicas contra Mazinger Z!
Gekisen! Kikaijuu VS Mazinger
episode.summary: In Mazinger Z, Koji has ultimate power. But he has no idea how to control it, and the consequences of this are shown in blood. Koji will have to shake his uncertainty soon, as the awful might of Dr. Hell`s Mechanical Beasts descends on him! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 出撃! あしゅら軍団
Sortie! Ashura Corps
¡Ataca, ejército del Barón Ashura!
Shutsugeki! Ashura Gundan
episode.summary: The Super Robot Mazinger Z will make Koji transcend humanity and allow him to become a god or a devil! But even with his newfound power, can Koji withstand the might of Baron Ashura? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 鉄壁! くろがね五人衆!
Impregnable! The Kurogane Five!
¡Muro de acero!¡Los cinco de la mansión Kurogane!
Teppeki! Kurogane Goninshuu!
episode.summary: Baron Ashura`s all-out assault on Japan doesn`t stop with just Mechanical Beasts. A group of deadly assassin androids assault the Kurogane House, but the Kurogane Five is there to stop them! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 発動! 日本侵略作戦!
Commence! The Japan Invasion Operation!
¡Asalto!¡La invasión de Japón!
Hatsudou! Nippon Shinryaku Sakusen!
episode.summary: Koji is frustrated by Baron Ashura`s repeated assaults, and the apparent weakness of his allies. But for all his strength, Tsubasa won`t let him go to Bardos Island. That is, until he can touch an old woman`s shoulder... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 誕生! あしゅら男爵!
Birth! Baron Ashura
La genesi del Barone Ashura
¡El nacimiento del Barón Ashura!
Tanjou! Ashura Danshaku!
episode.summary: Just who is Tsubasa Nishikiori? Each of Dr. Hell`s commanders are powerless before her, and Dr. Hell himself seems to fear her. At least she`s on Koji`s side... right? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 伝説! バードス島の機械獣!
Legend! The Mechanical Beasts of Bardos!
¡La leyenda de las bestias mecánicas de la isla de Bardos!
Densetsu! Bardos-tou no Kikaijuu!
episode.summary: Led by the mysterious woman who helped Koji save the city, the members of the Kurogane House resort come to rescue Koji. They`re much more than they seem, but they aren`t the only ones putting up a false front! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 挟撃! 機械獣大作戦!
Pincer movement! Mechanical Beasts big strategy!
¡Trampa!¡La gran ofensiva de las bestias mecánicas!
Kyougeki! Kikaijuu Daisakusen!
episode.summary: Finally free to sortie, Koji shows what Mazinger Z can do when its full power is unleashed. But Baron Ashura brings an abrupt end to the unstoppable rampage when Sayaka`s life is threatened. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 脱出! 海底要塞サルード!
Escape! Undersea Fortress Saluud!
Fuga dalla fortezza sottomarina
¡Escape!¡La fortaleza submarina Salude!
Dasshutsu! Kaitei Yousai Saluud!
episode.summary: Baron Ashura might have thought to give the surrendered Koji and Mazinger Z over to Dr. Hell, but that plan is foiled as Count Brocken turns his flying fortress on the Ashura Army! Baron Ashura makes a final, desperate move. Can Mazinger escape? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 初恋? 美少女ローレライ!
First love? Beautiful Girl Lorelei!
Lorelei
¿Primer amor? ¡La bella Lorelei!
Hatsukoi? Bishoujo Lorelei!
episode.summary: A young blonde-haired girl visits the Kurogane House, and claims she`s the daughter of a dead man. Shiro, having fallen for Lorelai, is led to Germany, where her father lives. Koji goes after him... but what`s this about a Kabuto family secret? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 慙愧! 暴かれる兜家の大罪!
Shame! The grave sin of the Kabuto family exposed!
¡Vergüenza!¡El secreto de la familia Kabuto!
Zanki! Abakareru Kabutoke no Daizai!
episode.summary: Layer upon layer of mysteries shroud the Kabuto family. Each question answered only brings more confusion. Meanwhile, Stroheim cares only about his promised duel with Juzo Kabuto--even more than his debt to Dr. Hell! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 対決! 悲しみの青きドナウ!
Confrontation! The Sorrowful Blue Donau!
¡Lucha! ¡El sufrimiento del Danubio Azul!
Taiketsu! Kanashimi no Aoki Donau!
episode.summary: Stroheim reveals the truth of Lorelai`s existence, and begs her to see his rivalry through to its conclusion. Will Stroheim`s Donau Alpha 1 be enough to beat Juzo`s Mazinger Z? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 発掘! 戦闘頭脳ケドラ!
Exhumation! Battle Intellect Kedora!
¡Exhumación! ¡La inteligencia de combate de Kedora!
Hakkutsu! Sentou Zunou Kedora!
episode.summary: Frustrated by his losses, Dr. Hell unleashes the Kedora. The strange beast takes over Mazinger Z, but there`s more to the creature than meets the eye! Mycenae might not be as dead as it seems. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 遺恨! くろがね屋の一番長い日 (前編)
Grudge! The longest Day of the Kurogane House (First Part)
¡Rencor! ¡El día más largo de la Mansión Kurogane! (1ª Parte)
Ikon! Kuroganeya no Ichiban Nagai Hi (Zenpen)
episode.summary: A ghost from the past haunts Tsubasa, draining the life from her. Who is the mysterious young man, and what role did he play in the past? But the trouble is just beginning for the Kurogane House! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 消滅! ミケーネの最後日!
Disappearance! The last Day of the Mikene!
¡Exterminio! ¡El último día de los Mikene!
Shoumetsu! Mycenae no Saigo Hi!
episode.summary: Everything is bad, but Koji and the crew won`t go down without a fight! Mazinger Z aids Zeus in a desperate fight against Hades, and the Kurogane Five carve a path to the Kedora. But will Baron Ashura betray the past, or the present? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 共闘! 危険な過去への旅!
Joint Struggle! Travel to the dangerous Past!
¡Tregua! ¡Un peligroso viaje al pasado!
Kyoutou! Kiken na Kako e no Tabi!
episode.summary: The Kedora is out of control, and Koji must team up with Baron Ashura in order to take out the ancient soldier. But they find themselves confronted with the past, and bear witness to the day Mycenae ended. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 接近! 機械獣あしゅら男爵!
Getting Closer! Machine Beast Baron Asura!
¡Aproximación! ¡La bestia mecánica, Barón Ashura!
Sekkin! Kikaijuu Ashura Danshaku!
episode.summary: In the calm before the storm, Dr. Hell makes a surprise appearance, and challenges Koji to settle everything with a 1-on-1 duel: Mazinger Z vs. Mechanical Beast Baron Ashura! But will Koji accept? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 夢幻! 眠れる繭のあしゅら
Dreams! Asura Sleeping Inside a Cocoon
¡Ensoñación! El letargo del Barón Ashura
Mugen! Nemureru Mayu no Ashura
episode.summary: The fall of Mycenae. Baron Ashura`s torment. Koji`s trascending humanity with Mazinger Z. Look upon the past, then ahead to the future, as nothing short of all out war will happen from here on out! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 遺恨! くろがね屋の一番長い日 (後編)
Grudge! The longest Day of the Kurogane House (Last Part)
¡Rencor! ¡El día más largo de la Mansión Kurogane! (Última Parte)
Ikon! Kuroganeya no Ichiban Nagai Hi (Kouhen)
episode.summary: The severed arm of Zeus--the God Scrander! With it, Mazinger Z is even more powerful than before. But Mazinger Z isn`t the only one getting new toys. Will it be enough, however, when Dr. Hell gets serious? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 遺恨! くろがね屋の一番長い日 (中編)
Grudge! The longest Day of the Kurogane House (Middle Part)
¡Rencor! ¡El día más largo de la Mansión Kurogane! (2ª Parte)
Ikon! Kuroganeya no Ichiban Nagai Hi (Chuuhen)
episode.summary: More layers of mystery are peeled away as Tsubasa`s health worsens. Why did she kill her husband? Why does Energer Z look just like Mazinger Z? But even on death`s door, Tsubasa has a card up her sleeve! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 決着! ロケットパンチ百連発!
Conclusion! The Hundred Barrage Rocket Punch!
¡Conclusión! ¡Cientos de Puños Fuera!
Kecchaku! Rocket Punch Hyaku Renpatsu!
episode.summary: The end has come. But why do some of the crew have an uneasy feeling about Baron Ashura? Why does everything lead back to Mycenae? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 逆転! バードスの落日!
Reversal! Setting Sun of Bardos!
¡Cambio de tornas! ¡La caída de Bardos!
Gyakuten! Bardos no Rakujitsu!
episode.summary: Everything has led up to this point. Every card has been laid on the table. No more secrets, no more betrayals! The Hell King rises, casting its shadow over Atami! Can the crew hold out? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 死線! 総攻撃Dr.ヘル
Verge of Death! All-out Attack Dr. Hell
¡A vida o muerte! La ofensiva del Dr. Infierno
Shisen! Soukougeki Dr. Hell
episode.summary: The final battle begins, but the plan is in shambles! Koji has been lured into a trap, and without the power of Mazinger Z, the fate of Kurogane House, the Mazinger Army, and all of Atami is in peril! Source: crunchyroll
